attributes.action: Stop the removal of current areas of unrestricted free parking  Minehead harbour
attributes.additional_details:
In other areas of Minehead there is an availability of free parking – for residents, visitors, tourists and businesses alike. Why should this not continue to be the case in Quay Street & Quay Street West? 

Why should the Harbour be treated differently, this is both unfair and restrictive, and will put under threat what is at present a much valued community recreational asset.
attributes.background: The harbour is used by a strong local contingent for a number of recreational pursuits,coupled with the businesses in the Harbour, all providing employment and investment.The current provision of free parking is crucial to the economic stability & survival of the Harbour community

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This decision about free parking is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

Your local council also has a petitions process - you can find out more about it here:

https://www.westsomersetonline.gov.uk/Council---Democracy/Have-Your-Say/Petitions
